intro: Astragalus alamkuhensis, commonly known as the Alamkuh milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Iran. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender stems and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. Its leaves are trifoliate, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Astragalus alamkuhensis plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity in its native habitat.
